statement.tex: \\ %text We will tell you that \[\int \frac{e^x\cdot dx}{\sqrt{5-4e^x-e^{2x}}} = \int\frac{d\phi}{\sqrt{A^2-(\phi + B)^2}}\]\\ But what are the \underline\text{values of $A,B$ and $\phi$}? %
\\ %text Given that \[ I = \int\frac{d\phi}{\sqrt{3^2-(\phi+2)^2}}\], \underline\text{what will I be in terms of x}? %

reason.tex: \begin{align} \phi = e^x &\implies e^x\cdot dx = d\phi \\ \therefore \int\frac{e^x\cdot dx}{\sqrt{5-4e^x-e^{2x}}} &= \underbrace{\int\frac{d\phi}{\sqrt{5-4\phi-\phi^2}}}_{e^{2x} = (e^x)^2 = \phi^2} \\ \text{Now, }5-4\phi-\phi^2 &= -(\phi^2 + 4\phi - 5) \\ &= -\left[ (\phi + 2)^2 -4 - 5 \right] \\ &= 9-(\phi+2)^2 \\ \therefore \int\frac{d\phi}{\sqrt{5-4\phi-\phi^2}} &= \int\frac{d\phi}{\sqrt{3^2 - (\phi+2)^2}} \\ \implies A = 3&\text{ and }B = 2 \end{align}
